trans-unit.source: Provides the data portion of an <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageList"></xref>.
This is a sealed class, so you can not inherit from it.
Also, the constructor is private, so you cannot create a new instance of it.
An <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageListStreamer> is returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ImageStream%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList>.

However, you cannot use this class to load images to an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList> control by directly assigning the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ImageStream%2A> property from one <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList>.
Instead you should directly assign one <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList> instance to another (for example, `ImageList2 = ImageList1)`.
Releases all resources used by the current instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageListStreamer"></xref> class.
Call `Dispose` when you are finished using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageListStreamer>.
The `Dispose` method leaves the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageListStreamer> in an unusable state.

After calling `Dispose`, you must release all references to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageListStreamer> so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageListStreamer> was occupying.

For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).
Always call `Dispose` before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageListStreamer>.
Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageListStreamer> object's `Finalize` method.
Populates a <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> with the data needed to serialize the target object.
For more information and a code example, see <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable?displayProperty=fullName>.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> that is the destination for this serialization.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> cannot be populated with data because no data exists, or it is not in the correct format.
